question: A particle is in uniform circular motion. The equation of its trajectory is given by <katex>$(x-2)^2 + y^2 = 25$</katex>, where x and y are in meter. The speed of the particle is <katex>$2ms^{-1}$</katex>. When the particle attains the lowest 'y' co-ordinate, the acceleration of the particle is (in <katex>$ms^{-2}$</katex>)
explanation: Direction towards center (upwards from lowest point), so <katex>$\vec{a_c} = 0.8\hat{j}$</katex>. [cite: 900]
